intro: Trichosanchezia chrysothrix, commonly known as the golden hair-vetch, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant has compound leaves with numerous leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
